qas.question: What determines the speed in which mail reaches Guam from the United States?

answers.text: on size and time of year

qas.question: Which type of service usually takes less than a week to get postage to the island?
What do most Guam residents use when receiving mail?

answers.text: post office boxes or private mail boxes

qas.question: Which is more important when it comes to shipping speed to Guam, size or time of year?
How long does fourth-class mail take to get to Guam?
How long does it take for a ship to sail from Hawaii to Guam?
How long does it take a boat to go from the U.S. Mainland to Guam?

context: The speed of mail traveling between Guam and the states varies depending <a0_0>on size and <b3_0>time of year<b3_0/><a0_0/>. Light, <a1_0>first-class<a1_0/> items generally take less than a week to or from the mainland, but larger first-class or Priority items can take <b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>a week or two<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/>. Fourth-class mail, such as magazines, are transported by sea after reaching Hawaii. Most residents use <a2_0>post office boxes or private mail boxes<a2_0/>, although residential delivery is becoming increasingly available. Incoming mail not from the Americas should be addressed to "Guam" instead of "USA" to avoid being routed the long way through the U.S. mainland and possibly charged a higher rate (especially from Asia).
